## Description {#details}

This file defines an InstructionCost class that is used when calculating the cost of an instruction, or a group of instructions.

In addition to a numeric value representing the cost the class also contains a state that can be used to encode particular properties, such as a cost being invalid. Operations on InstructionCost implement saturation arithmetic, so that accumulating costs on large cost-values don&#39;t overflow.

<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instructioncost/#a964cfda478e11c52ec46d73eb3185029a30cd573b546b4b6ec8a46680544db2c3"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instructioncost/#a964cfda478e11c52ec46d73eb3185029a30cd573b546b4b6ec8a46680544db2c3">Invalid</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &lt; Invalid indicates there is no way to represent the cost as a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// numeric value. This state exists to represent a possible issue,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// e.g. if the cost-model knows the operation cannot be expanded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// into a valid code-sequence by the code-generator.  While some</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// passes may assert that the calculated cost must be valid, it is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// up to individual passes how to interpret an Invalid cost. For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// example, a transformation pass could choose not to perform a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// transformation if the resulting cost would end up Invalid.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// Because some passes may assert a cost is Valid, it is not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// recommended to use Invalid costs to model &#39;Unknown&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// Note that Invalid is semantically different from a (very) high,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// but valid cost, which intentionally indicates no issue, but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">            /// rather a strong preference not to select a certain operation.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For all of the arithmetic operators provided here any invalid state is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// perpetuated and cannot be removed. Once a cost becomes invalid it stays</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// invalid, and it also inherits any invalid state from the RHS.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Arithmetic work on the actual values is implemented with saturation,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to avoid overflow when using more extreme cost values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For the comparison operators we have chosen to use lexicographical</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ordering where valid costs are always considered to be less than invalid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// costs. This avoids having to add asserts to the comparison operators that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the states are valid and users can test for validity of the cost</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// explicitly.</span></CodeLine>
